fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37409].
  {panel}

There is a KB regarding Google Macro Update which is required after the APIs change in Google.
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CLOUDKB/Google+Macro+update+required+in+Atlassian+Cloud

We should definitely include the update explained in the KB into the official documentation because by only having Google Apps integrate to the instance is not going to enable the Google Docs Macro. The user must install Confluence Google Drive add-on to enable the Google Docs Macro.

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/Using+Google+Docs+with+Google+Apps+Integration
fields.summary: Using Google Docs with Google Apps Integration need to be updated

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37408].
  {panel}

When our customer go to backup manager they are finding the following recommendation:
!backupManager.PNG|thumbnail!
That is not correct at all and causes great friction during the migration, if a customer tries to import a Confluence cloud backup into any confluence between version 5.3 and 5.7.0 it will fail due the missing attachments reference in the content table.

Customer should first download the Confluence OD version and then once we release the next major version upgrade Confluence to that version as described in below Page:

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Migrating+from+Confluence+Cloud+to+Confluence+Server
fields.summary: Backup Manager page is giving misleading information to customers

fields.description:

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37407].

Right now, I can insert instructional text that automatically opens the JIRA macro or begins a user mention. 

It should also give me the option of opening the date picker, so that instructional text can be used for date pickers too.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37404].
  {panel}

h3. Steps to reproduce:

# Add some content in a page, have a big page with several texts.
# Create a JIRA issue in the middle of the page.
# You'll see that in JIRA it will show as "mentioned in" and the name of the page.
# If you click on it, it will show the whole page, and you'll have scroll until you find the JIRA issue.

It would be great to go to that specific part of the text that you created the JIRA issue.
fields.summary: Mentioned in link in JIRA should have an anchor to go directly to the specific area.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37403].
  {panel}

Situation:

- I have two pages in two different spaces.
- Page A (in space 1) has an include page macro of Page B (in space 2). 
- On page B I have several attached images. I go and do a space export of the space 1 that contains just Page A with its inclusion of Page B. 
- The content of Page B shows up on A but none of the attachments show up.

What happens here is that the XML backup doesn't map the content attached in different spaces but integrated to the space which you are performing the backup.

Would be useful to have this functionality
fields.summary: Include attachments from other Spaces in a XML backup

Regards,
Bosco Fernandes

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37397].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
On Confluence 5.7 with configured SMTP server:
# User A Create a page
# User B watch the page
# User A upload an attachment to the page using Attachments Macro
# User B does not receive notification

h3. Suggested Solution
User B should receive notification from changes made using Attachments Macro.
 
h3. Workaround 
Upload attachments using Edit Mode on page; user will naturally receive notifications.
fields.summary: No notification received when adding attachment via Attachments Macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37396].
  {panel}

We have launched Confluence as a self-help documentation to our enterprise (abt 10.000 users)
At this point we have launched with 60 pages, but expect this space to quickly grow. 

We welcome feedback and questions from our audience.
The team of technical writers is looking for a way to view all inline comments in one combined way. At this point we rely on email notifications and a manual page that brings all feedback together in one place. It is unrealistic to expect that we would review each pages for unresolved inline comments

We love inline comments and hope that this feature would be included for the management of inline comments of large public spaces going forward.
fields.summary: As a technical writer, I would like to see all unresolved inline comments for a space, in order to effectively manage reviews

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37387].
  {panel}

Hi there,

Currently we only record Thread name, Username, URL ,VM free memory at start of request (in KB), Change in free memory after request is finished (in KB), Time taken for request (in ms),  Remote address , Login Failures - "recordLoginFailure" in access logging.

It would be great if user's comment and download files can be logged in to the access logging as well

When a user commented or download attachment on a page, it shall recorded in the log together with the comment's text and the timestamp of the occurence.
fields.summary: Include user's comment/download to access log

hi,

We have a beautiful Java exception when we try to upload an attachment with a special characters.

" (warning) We recommend you don't use special characters in page or attachment names, as the page or attachment may not be found by Confluence search, and may cause some Confluence functions to behave unexpectedly."

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37385].
  {panel}

JIRA issues macro are not refreshing automatically. They just refresh after manually refreshing or flushing the cache in Confluence. Affects JIRA Macros 5.6.11.

h3. Workarounds
# Go to Admin > Cache Statistics, and Flush All
# Manually refresh the macro on the page.
fields.summary: REGRESSION - JIRA issue macro aggressively caches, new issues take a while to appear in the issues macro

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37381].
  {panel}

h3. ***Summary***
Content Report Table Macro cannot sort based on *Title* with some combinations of numeric titles.

h3. ***Steps to reproduce***
# Create Meeting Notes with the below combination at the begining of the title
{panel}
00-00-000 (/)
00-00-00 (/)
00-00 (/)
00-0000-00 (/)
00*00*0000 (/)
0000*00*00 (/)

00-00-0000 (x)
0000-00-00 (x)
{panel}
# Go to Meeting Notes root page
# Try to sort by title

h3. ***Expected behaviour***  
Content Report Table Macro should be able to be sorted based on *Title* with for all combinations of numeric titles.
fields.summary: Content Report Table Macro cannot sort based on Title

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37372].
  {panel}

our system and space CSS definitions are growing and make them hard to maintain manually.
We do have a system-wide CSS. While a space has no CSS itself, it will use the system-wide CSS. Fine.  
Though, many space administrators in our Confluence system wanted small CSS additions for their space which did not make sense to include into the system-wide CSS.
The current implementation of the CSS requires (at least up to 5.4) to copy the whole system-wide CSS to the space, and then add the additional space-specific customizations.

Suggestions:
1. I would prefer if the space-specific CSS would simply overwrite (merge with) the system-wide CSS, so we don't need to repeat them in each space. The pages should first read the system CSS, then the space CSS, then apply the combined content to the pages. This would eliminate a lot of redundant content in the space CSS'.
2. When upgrading from one Confluence release to another, frequently the spelling of CSS has changed. In case they are used in (potentially many) space CSS, all of these CSS need to be updated. In installations with many spaces, this can become a huge amount of work. So I'm looking for an administration tool which allows to add/delete/replace blocks of CSS to all space CSS where certain conditions are met (e..g. the existence of a certain CSS key which has been obsoleted or modified)
fields.summary: Would like to see an admin tool for CSS administration

+To Reproduce+

# Create a page called gliffy images

Environment:

Environment

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37368].
  {panel}

The following atlassian-plugin web-item adds an icon to the Confluence Page attachments section:

{code}
    <web-item key="my-plugin-attachment-buttons"
              name="web-item: my plugin attachment buttons"
              section="system.attachment"
              weight="10">

        <label key=""/> <!-- empty, display an icon instead -->

        <!-- attachment action icon -->
        <icon height="16" width="16">
            <link>/download/resources/com.my.plugin/icons/whatever-action_16x16.png</link>
        </icon>

        <tooltip key="my.plugin.attachment.i18n.interaction.tooltip.description"/>

        <!-- the link action -->
        <link>
            <![CDATA[/plugins/my-plugin/thing.action?bbq=asdf]]>
        </link>

        <!-- only show the button on attachments which are of our plugin type -->
        <condition class="com.my.plugin.IsMyTypeOfAttachmentCondition"/>
    </web-item>
{code}

As you can see, it contains an icon section, and an empty label. This web-item works perfectly when viewing Confluence page attachments ({{/pages/viewpageattachments.action?pageId=x}}).

However, when a Confluence Attachments macro is added to the Confluence page, the button is rendered incorrectly, with the icon missing.
fields.summary: Confluence Attachments macro does not support icons, despite attachment web-item icons being a valid parameter

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37363].
  {panel}

*Symptom*
You are trying to create a new label for a Confluence Space or page. Confluence does not recognize two words as being together.

*Cause*
Confluence currently does not respect a space between two words to create a multi-word label.

*Current behavior*
'My Label' will create two separate labels. 'My' and 'Label' Currently a user must include a - or _ between the two words to link them as one label.

*Requested behavior*
Encapsulating the label 'My Label' in parenthesis, should be treated as one label. i.e., 'My Label'
fields.summary: Allow multi-word labels within Confluence

The line breaking rules in East Asian language specify how to wrap East Asian Language text such as Chinese, Japanese, Korean. However, Confluence PDF export does not follow the rule. Due to this, for example, the punctuation comes at the beginning of the line as attached Problem.jpg.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37341].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Pages created using the _Create from Template_ button don't inherit labels from the template, if the page with the button includes other macros.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a template including a label. 
# Create or edit a page and insert the _Create from Template_ in it, pointing to the template with a label.
# Insert *Section Macro* on the same page and save the page.
# In the page view, use the _Create from Template_ macro to create to a new page.

h3. Expected Results
# The new page, once saved, has the label(s) set in the template. 

h3. Actual Results
The label is not set for the new page.

h3.Workaround
- Remove other macros from the page that includes the _Create from Template_ macro.
- Use the *Create* button in the top navigation bar to create pages from templates.
fields.summary: Setting the label from template doesn't work if the page containing the 'Create from Template' Macro has other macros on it

Turning on Debugging for Indexing will allow Confluence to write indexing activity in the log. ([KB article|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/How+to+Turn+on+Debugging+for+Indexing])

While the index debugging is enabled, performing manual index re/building ([instructions|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Content+Index+Administration#ContentIndexAdministration-Rebuildingthesearchindex]) will let Confluence trace every content that's being indexed. For example:

2015-04-23 23:21:15,528 DEBUG [Indexer: 1] [confluence.search.lucene.ReindexWorkBatch] indexCollection Index page: Tell people what you think in a comment (step 8 of 9) v.1 (98313) [com.atlassian.confluence.pages.Page]

However, while the index debugging is enabled, running the scheduled job "Flush Index Queue" will not have the details of content that being indexed (flushed from index queue). At the moment, the following is traced in the log:

It would be useful to have more detailed logging for Flush Index Queue Scheduled Job process when the index debugging is enabled. This will help system administrator maintaining the instance better.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37322].
  {panel}

*As a* User in all possible roles
*in order to* save time & money and prevent unintended problems caused by the current implementation
*I want to* have a modernized version of Backup & Restore (from now on *BR*) in Confluence.

*Acceptance criteria*
* BR is GUI based
* BR functionality is integrated in GUI where it is needed, e.g. Attachment handling
* BR allows me to do a full B
* BR allows me to backup a specific Space 
* BR allows me to do a full BR + allow me to BR specify space(s) in addition
* BR allows me to schedule a full B(ackup)
* BR allows me to schedule a B of one or more spaces independent to the full B
* BR allows me to restore the full B
* BR allows me to restore a specific Space
* BR allows me to restore a specific Attachment according to CONF-37321
* BR allows fully encrypted backups
* BR allows storing on remote locations
** BR remote locations can be NFS, SMB, HTTPS, SFTP, ? based
* There are dedicated roles for Full BR, Space BR and potentially Attachment R

*Related to*
* CONF-6821
* CONF-6824
* CONF-37320
* CONF-37321
fields.summary: Modernize Confluence Backup & Restore

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37307].
  {panel}

At the moment, page watchers or owner will receive an email every time a task is checked/unchecked. This feature is good to notify any changes performed in a page.

However, for a page that's constantly used to track task status (frequent use of checking/unchecking task), the page watcher can receive huge number of emails every day.

The process of checking/unchecking task can be done without editing page, hence it's not possible to turn off the "notify watchers" functionality.

It would be useful to have the ability to switch off email notification for checking/unchecking task in a page to avoid email spam to the user.

h3.Workaround
Disable the {{tasks-notification}} module in the *Confluence Inline Tasks* add-on in {{Confluence Admin >> Manage Add-ons}}. But note that this is not recommended as there may be side effects to this (possible dependency from other plugins).
fields.summary: Ability to Switch Off Email Notification When Checking/Unchecking Task

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37303].
  {panel}

I cloned this as we are facing the exact issue as described below:

h3. Summary of Bug

If the Page Properties macro is used in a template, along with a variable as the value of the page property, the macro will face an error when trying to create from template, and the macro will be erased when the page is created.

h3. Steps to replicate

# Create a template that uses the Page Properties macro, with a label property set and with a variable as a value
# Try to create a page using that template. There will be an error in the Page Template Wizard
# If the user clicks on 'Next', the resulting page creation section will no longer have the Page Properties Macro
fields.summary: Page Properties Macro does not work if used with a label and variable in a template/blueprint

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37302].
  {panel}

*Environment:*
Browser: Chrome v42
OS: Mac OSX 10.10.3

Hi there,

I have been able to reproduce this error twice.
When attempting to learn a new a word using the Spelling and Grammar option in Chrome, the dialog appears and allows me to "Learn" the words.
It gets to a certain point (at random) while cycling through and learning the unknown words on my confluence page and then freezes.

At this point I can no longer click learn, scroll the page or do anything.
Rather frustrating when I have entered a body of text for a page and then attempt to learn these words and lose all my work.

Yes, I can choose not to learn the words and have red lines throughout my document, but it would be nice to be able to use the learn feature without a freeze.

Cheers,
Ben.

*Steps:*
# Open confluence page in chrome browser
# Edit a created page
# Enter a series of unknown words (invoke the red underline)
# Open spelling and grammar
# Learn words until one of them becomes unresponsive
# Page frozen
fields.summary: Tab Freezes For New Words in Spelling and Grammar

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37290].
  {panel}

This is taken from Support ticket:
{panel}
Attachment indexing seems very slow and database server intensive. So we took a look at the queries being made to investigate.

I took a quick look at one of the queries and ran EXPLAIN EXTENDED on it to see the query plan:
{noformat}
select attachment0_.ATTACHMENTID as ATTACHME1_, attachment0_.TITLE as TITLE, attachment0_.CONTENTTYPE as CONTENTT3_, attachment0_.PAGEID as PAGEID, attachment0_.CREATOR as CREATOR, attachment0_.CREATIONDATE as CREATION6_ , attachment0_.LASTMODIFIER as LASTMODI7_, attachment0_.LASTMODDATE as LASTMODD8_, attachment0_.FILESIZE as FILESIZE, attachment0_.MINOR_EDIT as MINOR_EDIT, attachment0_.ATTACHMENT_COMMENT as ATTACHM11_, attachment0_.ATTVERSION as ATTVERSION, attachment0_.PREVVER as PREVVER from ATTACHMENTS attachment0_ where (attachment0_.ATTVERSION in(select max(attachment1_.ATTVERSION) from ATTACHMENTS attachment1_ where (attachment1_.PREVVER=80807965 )or(attachment1_.ATTACHMENTID=80807965 ) group by  attachment1_.LASTMODIFIER))and((attachment0_.PREVVER=80807965 )or(attachment0_.ATTACHMENTID=80807965 )) order by  attachment0_.ATTVERSION asc

--------------
{noformat}
MySQL shows this as the output:
{noformat}

*************************** 1. row ***************************
ATTACHME1_: 80807965
     TITLE: CC for new user - returning new user - on page load.png
CONTENTT3_: image/png
    PAGEID: 80652240
   CREATOR: 8a3a28b1455348d80145534a829111f5
CREATION6_: 2012-08-29 11:39:28
LASTMODI7_: 8a3a28b1455348d80145534a829111f5
LASTMODD8_: 2012-08-29 11:39:28
  FILESIZE: 56247
MINOR_EDIT:  
ATTACHM11_: NULL
ATTVERSION: 2
   PREVVER: NULL
1 row in set (1.43 sec)
{noformat}
Notice the run time. (quite slow).

The EXPLAIN plan shows:
{noformat}
*************************** 1. row ***************************
           id: 1
  select_type: PRIMARY
        table: attachment0_
         type: ALL
possible_keys: PRIMARY,att_prevver_idx
          key: NULL
      key_len: NULL
          ref: NULL
         rows: 283170
     filtered: 100.00
        Extra: Using where; Using filesort
*************************** 2. row ***************************
           id: 2
  select_type: SUBQUERY
        table: attachment1_
         type: index
possible_keys: PRIMARY,att_prevver_idx,FK_ATTACHMENTS_LASTMODIFIER
          key: FK_ATTACHMENTS_LASTMODIFIER
      key_len: 768
          ref: NULL
         rows: 283170
     filtered: 100.00
        Extra: Using where
2 rows in set, 1 warning (0.00 sec)
{noformat}
The explain plan shows that to execute this query it’s scanning the attachments table and then for each row of the attachments table it’s scanning it again.
That is doing 283,170 x 283,170 row scans which is 80,185,248,900 rows for each attachment query.

If you’re doing this for each attachment that’s going to take ~ 1 second x 283,170 rows which is a long time.

The actual number of rows in the table (MySQL shows the estimated number of rows):
{noformat}
[confluence566]> select count(*) from attachments;
+----------+
| count(*) |
+----------+
|   288015 |
+----------+
1 row in set (0.19 sec)
{noformat}
I looked at the data structure of the table:
{noformat}
root@dev-server [confluence566]> show create table attachments\G
*************************** 1. row ***************************
       Table: attachments
Create Table: CREATE TABLE `attachments` (
  `ATTACHMENTID` bigint(20) NOT NULL DEFAULT '0',
  `TITLE` varchar(255) COLLATE utf8_bin NOT NULL DEFAULT '',
  `CONTENTTYPE` varchar(255) COLLATE utf8_bin NOT NULL DEFAULT '',
  `PAGEID` bigint(20) NOT NULL DEFAULT '0',
  `CREATOR` varchar(255) COLLATE utf8_bin DEFAULT NULL,
  `CREATIONDATE` datetime DEFAULT NULL,
  `LASTMODIFIER` varchar(255) COLLATE utf8_bin DEFAULT NULL,
  `LASTMODDATE` datetime DEFAULT NULL,
  `FILESIZE` bigint(20) DEFAULT NULL,
  `ATTACHMENT_COMMENT` varchar(255) COLLATE utf8_bin DEFAULT NULL,
  `ATTVERSION` int(11) DEFAULT NULL,
  `PREVVER` bigint(20) DEFAULT NULL,
  `MINOR_EDIT` bit(1) DEFAULT NULL,
  PRIMARY KEY (`ATTACHMENTID`),
  KEY `att_pageid_idx` (`PAGEID`),
  KEY `att_prevver_idx` (`PREVVER`),
  KEY `FK_ATTACHMENTS_LASTMODIFIER` (`LASTMODIFIER`),
  KEY `FK_ATTACHMENTS_CREATOR` (`CREATOR`),
  CONSTRAINT `FK54475F9017D4A070` FOREIGN KEY (`PREVVER`) REFERENCES `attachments` (`ATTACHMENTID`),
  CONSTRAINT `FK54475F908C38FBEA` FOREIGN KEY (`PAGEID`) REFERENCES `content` (`CONTENTID`),
  CONSTRAINT `FK_ATTACHMENTS_CREATOR` FOREIGN KEY (`CREATOR`) REFERENCES `user_mapping` (`user_key`),
  CONSTRAINT `FK_ATTACHMENTS_LASTMODIFIER` FOREIGN KEY (`LASTMODIFIER`) REFERENCES `user_mapping` (`user_key`),
  CONSTRAINT `_FK54475F908C38FBEA` FOREIGN KEY (`PAGEID`) REFERENCES `content` (`CONTENTID`)
) ENGINE=InnoDB DEFAULT CHARSET=utf8 COLLATE=utf8_bin
1 row in set (0.00 sec)
{noformat}
So it looks like this table is perhaps not indexed in a way which makes it easy to find the data that’s being looked for.
The table structure seems to have the same same issue.

Joining the data in a single query forces MySQL to combine things in a way which is not very efficient. It might be better to do some of these queries separately as they will be PK or index lookups and given the results adapt the remaining query that needs to be done.  This seems slower but if each individual query takes say 1ms then you get a gain of 1500x compared to the current behaviour.

{panel}
fields.summary: Improve SQL Query for Attachment Indexing On Large Instance
Confluence Reindex Runs Queries for Each Item before Batching Causing Performance Issue on Large Instance

*Improvement Request Background*

Confluence Excerpt macro, unlike Excerpt include macro does not allow users to put border around it to ensure that other users know about the existence of the excerpt macro. Hence other users will not be aware of the existence of excerpt macro in a page without going to edit mode.

*Workaround*

User could user [panel macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Panel+Macro] or [expand macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Expand+Macro] to describe the existence of "Excerpt Macro" in a page.

  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:
1. Start with a new installation of Confluence
2. Navigate to the "Global templates" screen of the admin console
3. Observe that blueprints (e.g. meeting notes) don't appear on this screen for editing
4. Create a page from any blueprint
5. Go back to the admin console
6. Observe that blueprints now appear for editing

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37281].
  {panel}

I'd like to be able to organize my favorites - either in the 'favourites' menu, or using a macro. At the moment, favouriting something is of little to no use to me due to the fact that they one can only view them organized by the DATE that they were favourited instead of alphabetically. The favourites macro does the same thing, just embedded on a page. 

It would make the action of 'favouriting' significantly more useful if there was some flexibility to sort and filter favourites - either in the favourites menu, or using the macro.
 
Here are a few relatively basic functions that would be helpful parameters to add to the favourites macro that would make favouriting a page a lot more impactful:
* Show favourites all from a particular space or set of spaces
* Filter favourites based on content type - page or blogpost
* Filter favourites based on a label given to the favourited page
* Different sorting: date, alphabetically by page
fields.summary: Organize, Filter & Sort Favourites

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37255].
  {panel}

h3. Current Behaviour
- If Word document is too large to display using Office Word Macro, Confluence is still trying to display it and might result to OOME 

h3. Feature Request 
- If Word document is too large to display using Office Word Macro and it might result to OOME, Confluence should refuse to display it.
fields.summary: Office Word Macro should refuse to display too large documents that might cause OOME

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37251].
  {panel}

h4. Problem
Supporting Confluence requires access to various information. Thread dumps, GC logs, SQL logging, access logging, etc. Confluence has very minimal logging enabled by default (out of that list only GC logging is enabled by default), and for good reason as log files would greatly increase their included content if all logging options were enabled (as most logging is done in atlassian-confluence.log). Some logging, for example SQL logging, is useless unless configuration files are change and Confluence is restarted (which is a huge inconvenience)

Further, to gather these logs requires generating a support zip through the Support Tools Plugin in the Confluence admin console (which does not always include the additional GC logging). This process is impossible to perform if Confluence cannot start, and makes gathering necessary information (i.e. configuration files in addition to logs) difficult for support and for the user.

h4. Proposed Solution
# Add the ability to create a support zip from the command line
** Accomplished via a script that gathers the same/similar information as a standard support zip
# Improve SQL logging when enabled from the UI
** Include trace logging to get the parameters being passed to the query
** Split this additional logging into its own .log file
# Fix (or remove) the thread dumps generated via the Confluence UI
** Currently Confluence does not generate full system thread dumps, and every time a thread dump is needed this article is linked: [Generating Thread Dumps Externally|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Generating+a+Thread+Dump+Externally]
** Either get the same information as an external thread dump or remove the feature entirely as it is not used by support
# Enable access logging by default and separate into its own .log file
** JIRA has this logging enabled by default
fields.summary: Improve Confluence Support Tools and logging

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37249].
  {panel}

hi there,

i have issues linking our confluence 5.7.1 with our jira 6.4.1.
Both are local installations. 

When i try to link confluence with jira it seems wo work at first time, but then the Warning 

"Anwendungsverknüpfung '4Com Intranet' wurde erfolgreich lokal erstellt, aber die reziproke Verknüpfung nicht. Bitte überprüfen Sie die Konfiguration."
"Application shortcut '4Com Intranet' was successfully created local, but the reciprocal link is not. Please check the configuration."

Do you have any idea?

best regards 
marc

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37241].
  {panel}

We use page blueprints extensively to drive automation in confluence and Jira.

Once a blueprint plugin is deployed it is available in the "Create Page" dialog for every space, however we want the blueprint to be available only to the space/s for which it is relevant.

Currently confluence supports disabling the blueprint manually for a space through Space Tools -> Content tools -> Templates.
In practical scenario there can be hundreds and thousands of spaces so disabling manually for each space is tedious and cumbersome.
We are looking for a programmatic interface to disable blueprints for spaces in bulk.
fields.summary: Restrict page blueprint to a space programmatically
Livesearch Macro Should Allow Search in Multiple Spaces

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37236].
  {panel}

Confluence Multimedia Macro declares that the application provides support to WMV videos, see excerpt below.

However, that does not appear to be valid, as per our tests, and per ticket 
- https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-27581

(i) Please update documentation to reflect current macro capabilities, and decrease friction. :)

{quote}
The multimedia macro is used to embed attached video, animation and other multimedia files on a Confluence page.

Confluence supports the following multimedia formats:

Adobe Flash (.swf)
Apple QuickTime (.mov)
*Windows Media (.wma, .wmv)*
Real Media (.rm, .ram)
MP3 and MP4 files (.mp3, .mp4)
MPEG files (.mpeg, .mpg)
AVI files (.avi) You may need to enable an avi decoder within your browser.
{quote}

Browsers were we tested:
|Chrome| Version 41.0.2272.118 (64-bit)| Windows & Mac OS X|
|Safari| Version 8.0.2 (10600.2.5)|Mac OS X|
|Firefox|34.0.5|Mac OS X|
